channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: ‘If you win Pennsylvania, you win the whole thing’: Trump prepares for debate with Harris
item.description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris will face off in a high-stakes debate in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, a crucial swing state for the 2024 presidential election. Both candidates have made frequent visits to the state. Harris focuses on economic issues like prescription drug prices while Trump emphasizes economic strength and inflation concerns.

item.title: Egyptian scientist starts petition to return Nefertiti bust
item.description: Former Egyptian antiquities minister Zahi Hawass has launched a petition urging Germany to return the bust of Queen Nefertiti, housed in Berlin's Neues Museum. Discovered by a German team in 1912 and taken to Europe in 1913, the bust is among three significant artifacts Hawass seeks to repatriate. He emphasises that only items removed illegally are targeted.

item.title: Prince Harry defends keeping royal title amid ongoing tensions: 'What difference would it make?'
item.description: Prince Harry discussed the decision to keep royal titles after stepping down in 2020, emphasizing challenges in private communication due to leaks and briefings against him and Meghan Markle. The interview highlights ongoing tensions within the Royal Family, particularly with his father King Charles III and brother Prince William.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Marcee Gray called Apalachee high school to report 'emergency', drove 200 miles after son’s disturbing text, says grandfather
item.description: Marcee Gray, mother of Colt Gray, who has been charged in the Apalachee High School shooting that killed four and injured nine, expressed deep remorse. She received a concerning text from her son before the incident and alerted authorities. Colt faces murder charges while his father is charged with involuntary manslaughter for purchasing the rifle used.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump threatens 100% tariff to defend dollar’s global dominance: Implications for India and beyond
item.description: Donald Trump announced a plan to impose a 100% tariff on goods from countries that move away from using the US dollar in international trade. This strategy targets de-dollarization efforts by nations like China and India. The announcement comes as Trump campaigns against Kamala Harris, emphasizing economic nationalism and defending the dollar's global dominance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump holds razor-thin lead over Harris in latest poll, but battleground states remain key
item.description: Donald Trump holds a narrow lead over Kamala Harris in the latest New York Times/Siena College poll, with 48 percent of voters supporting him compared to Harris's 47 percent. This follows President Joe Biden's decision to step aside and endorse Harris for the 2024 presidential race. The outcome hinges on key battleground states.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pope Francis visits remote town in Papua New Guinea
item.description: Pope Francis visited Papua New Guinea's remote town of Vanimo, bringing humanitarian aid and addressing tribal and gender-based violence. He also celebrated Mass in Port Moresby, emphasizing faith for the marginalized. This visit is part of his extensive trip across Southeast Asia and Oceania, highlighting the church's focus on peripheries.

item.title: Prince Harry’s subtle dig at King Charles: 'Meghan and I were upfront, unlike "others" we didn't ... ' after explosive Oprah interview
item.description: Prince Harry, in his memoir Spare, takes a jab at King Charles and the royal family's media tactics. He contrasts their use of anonymous sources with his and Meghan Markle's openness during their 2021 Oprah interview. This highlights ongoing tensions within the family over how they handle media relations.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kentucky police hunt gunman in I-75 highway shooting, 'It's a big task ... ': What we know so far
item.description: Kentucky police are intensifying their search for Joseph Couch, suspected of shooting at vehicles on Interstate 75 and injuring five people. The manhunt is focused on a remote area near London, Kentucky. Authorities recovered an AR-style rifle from his car. Residents are advised to stay home as the search continues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump to face off in first-ever debate amid tight race for White House - What are the rules?
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris and former president Donald Trump will face off in a debate for the first time on Tuesday, each seeking an edge in what has become a neck-and-neck race for the White House. Trump and Harris will each be given a pen, a pad of paper, and a bottle of water.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Burned alive': At least 48 killed in Nigeria after fuel tanker collides with truck
item.description: A devastating collision between a fuel tanker and another truck in Nigeria's Niger state resulted in an explosion that killed at least 48 people and 50 animals. Emergency services discovered additional victims burned beyond recognition. Governor Mohammed Bago urged residents to stay calm and stressed the importance of following traffic regulations to avoid future tragedies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Melania Trump speaks about 2020 election: 'Efforts to silence my husband'
item.description: Melania Trump released a teaser video for her upcoming memoir, noting how the 2020 election changed their lives, affecting food prices and free speech. This comes amid speculation about her absence from Donald Trump's campaign and Scaramucci's recent claim that Melania wants Kamala Harris to win the election more than anyone else.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bangladesh to take steps to get Hasina extradited to face genocide trial
item.description: Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal will begin proceedings to extradite former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina from India on genocide charges related to a student-led uprising that toppled her government. Chief prosecutor Mohammad Tajul Islam, associated with Jamaat-e-Islami, highlighted the critical need to safeguard evidence for these trials.

item.title: Maduro's challenger Gonzalez flees Venezuela, seeks asylum in Spain
item.description: Edmundo Gonzalez, former Venezuelan opposition presidential candidate, has fled to Spain after receiving asylum. The Venezuelan government facilitated his departure following an arrest warrant to restore political peace. Spain will grant him political asylum, and he plans to continue campaigning against the regime from abroad.

item.title: Popular Hawaii hiking trail shut after 37 fall sick in 'rare' norovirus outbreak
item.description: The Kalalau Trail on Kauai island in Hawaii has been shut down following reports of over three dozen hikers contracting norovirus. Health officials are evaluating the risk and disinfecting the trail, which will remain closed until at least September 19. Norovirus spreads easily through contaminated surfaces and causes gastrointestinal issues.

item.title: Evidence against Imran points towards military trial: Pak's defence min
item.description: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has suggested that evidence against former prime minister Imran Khan indicates a military trial for his alleged involvement in the May 9 violence. Khan has sought to prevent this through a petition in the Islamabad High Court, which faced procedural objections from the court.

item.title: Imran Khan's party stage rally in Islamabad; demand his immediate release
item.description: Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf organized a significant rally near Islamabad, calling for his release and denouncing the government's crackdown. Thousands participated despite obstacles. PTI leaders committed to continuous protests until Khan is released and planned additional rallies nationwide. New legislation now penalizes unauthorized gatherings in Islamabad.

item.title: Bangladesh interim govt warns against communal unrest during Durga puja
item.description: Bangladesh's interim government has issued a stern warning against any disruptions during Durga puja, set for October 9 to 13. They pledge strict action against troublemakers and have engaged local communities and madrasa students for temple security. This follows recent violence targeting Hindus after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's resignation.

item.title: Bangladesh-India ties must be based on fairness and equity, says Yunus
item.description: Interim government chief adviser Muhammad Yunus emphasized the need for equitable and fair relations with India during a meeting with students involved in the recent revolution. He highlighted mutual respect and regional cooperation through SAARC. Bangladesh's foreign affairs adviser expressed surprise at Indian defense minister Rajnath Singh's comments on potential conflicts.

item.title: Two NATO members say Russian drones violated their airspace
item.description: Two NATO members reported Russian drones violating their airspace; one entered Romania and another crashed in Latvia. Romania deployed F-16 jets and issued alerts to residents. Ukraine faced deadly airstrikes with civilian casualties. German Chancellor Scholz stated that future peace talks would involve Russia and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy.
